verses.text: David said in his heart, 'One day I will be destroyed by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than to escape to the land of the Philistines; then Saul will give up searching for me in all the territory of Israel, and I will escape from his hand.'
verses.comment: Retains David's reasoning and his plan to escape Saul by going to the Philistines.

verses.text: So David got up and went over, he and the six hundred men who were with him, to Achish son of Maoch, king of Gath.
verses.comment: References David's previous interaction with Achish and Gath.

verses.text: David lived with Achish at Gath, he and his men, each man with his household, and David with his two wives: Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail of Carmel, the widow of Nabal.
verses.comment: Names David’s wives as given in previous chapters.

verses.text: When Saul was told that David had fled to Gath, he no longer looked for him.
verses.comment: Summarizes Saul ceasing pursuit upon hearing of David’s escape.

verses.text: Then David said to Achish, 'If I have found favor in your eyes, let them give me a place in one of the country towns, so that I can live there. Why should your servant live in the royal city with you?'
verses.comment: Faithful to David’s request and humility before Achish.

verses.text: So Achish gave him Ziklag that day. Therefore, Ziklag has belonged to the kings of Judah to this day.
verses.comment: Mentions historical possession of Ziklag by Judah's kings.

verses.text: The length of time that David lived in the country of the Philistines was one year and four months.
verses.comment: Adds the specific duration of David's stay.

verses.text: David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. For these peoples were the inhabitants of the land from ancient times, as far as Shur and the land of Egypt.
verses.comment: Clarifies the people groups and their territory.

verses.text: Whenever David attacked the land, he left neither man nor woman alive, but took away sheep, oxen, donkeys, camels, and clothing, and returned to Achish.
verses.comment: Describes David’s total raids and confiscation of livestock and goods.

verses.text: When Achish asked, 'Where have you made a raid today?' David would say, 'Against the Negev of Judah,' or 'Against the Negev of the Jerahmeelites,' or 'Against the Negev of the Kenites.'
verses.comment: Portrays David’s misleading reports to Achish.

verses.text: David did not leave alive a man or woman to be brought to Gath, saying, 'Otherwise they would tell about us, saying,
verses.comment: Explains David’s motive for not sparing anyone upon return.

verses.text: Achish believed David and thought, 'He has made himself utterly hated by his people Israel; therefore, he will be my servant forever.'
verses.comment: Represents Achish’s confidence in David’s loyalty based on David’s actions.
